IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Area Agency on Aging 1-B enhances the lives of older adults and adults with disabilities in the communities we serve.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Area Agency on Aging 1-B enhances the lives of older adults and adults with disabilities in the communities we serve.
IRS990.Desc: Prepaid Ambulatory Health Plan/Medicaid Waiver - The Area Agency on Aging 1-B supports the care of older adults and adults with disabilities who qualify medically and financially for the Federal/State medicaid long term care program to access a variety of home and community based services designed to maintain and enhance personal independence.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Community Support Services - The Area Agency on Agency 1-B allocates and monitors funding to support a variety of home and community based services that support adults and/or caregivers age 60 and older to maintain and enhance personal independence. This includes unbiased information and assistance to help individuals and families with understanding their care options.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Nutrition Program - The Area Agency on Aging 1-B allocated and monitors funding to support adults and/or caregivers age 60 and older in need of nutritious and balanced congregate and/or home delivered meals (also known as meals on wheels).

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Area Agency on Aging 1-B is a not-for-profit organization that is exempt from income taxes under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Agency's income tax filings are subject to audit by various taxing authorities, The Agency's open audit periods are for fiscal years ending September 30, 2015-2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The draft Form 990 is reviewed by the organizations Finance Committee and upon acceptance, is submitted to the full Board of Directors for approval.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All employees attend training sessions on the above practices; all employees and members of the Board of Directors complete a conflict of interest questionnaire annually.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A market analysis is completed of similar positions at similar organizations to establish the appropriate market salary range.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public on its website and upon request.
